{"step_by_step_thinking": "The retromolar pad is a key intraoral landmark in prosthodontics, as mentioned in Document [0]. It is located in the retromolar area and is covered by the lower denture for stability, as mentioned in the same document. The retromolar pad does not disappear on the eruption of mandibular last molars, as it is a separate structure. There is no mention of the tendon of the temporal muscle being attached to the retromolar pad in any of the documents.", "answer_choice": "B"}
